docs.title: Is my data private?
docs.text: Yes! Everything stays on your server: - Images stored locally (never uploaded to cloud) - Database on your server - Only AI requests send data to OpenRouter (and only when you trigger AI features)

docs.title: What data does OpenRouter see?
docs.text:
Only when you use AI features: - Image files (for image generation and inference) - Text prompts (for outfit generation) - Never your entire database

OpenRouter privacy: https://openrouter.ai/privacy

docs.title: Should I password-protect it?
docs.text: YES if accessible from internet. Options: 1. Nginx basic auth (simplest) 2. Tailscale/ZeroTier (VPN, most secure) 3. Cloudflare Access (SSO) 4. Custom auth (add to app, see CONTRIBUTING.md)

docs.title: Can I use this for commercial purposes?

The app is open source (MIT license). You can: - Use for business/commercial purposes - Modify and distribute - Sell services based on it

But you must: - Keep the MIT license notice - Respect OpenRouter's terms of service (for AI)

Not planned. The web interface is fully responsive and works great as a PWA (Add to Home Screen).

docs.title: Your First Item

Adding items is fast and easy—just a few taps to get started.

Desktop view when you first start - click the + Add Item button

docs.title: Step 1: Take a Photo
docs.text:
1. From the home screen, tap the + Add Item button (the big purple floating button)
  2. Choose Take Photo or Upload from Gallery
  3. Take a clear photo of your item laid flat or on a hanger
  4. Tip: Good lighting makes AI inference more accurate

docs.title: Step 2: Add Front View
docs.text:
• The first photo you upload is the front view (required)
  • Once uploaded, the photo appears immediately
  • Tap Continue to move to the next step

docs.title: Step 3: Add Back View (Optional)
docs.text:
• Add a back photo if your item has interesting details on the back
  • Skip this if you're in a hurry—you can always add it later
  • Tap Skip or Continue

docs.title: Step 4: Add Label/Detail Photos (Optional)
docs.text:
• Upload close-ups of:
  • Brand labels (helps AI identify brand and size)
  • Care labels (washing instructions)
  • Details like embroidery, buttons, or prints
  • Progressive disclosure: Only shown if you tap "Add More Photos"

  • Generating catalog images

Answer a few quick questions to guide the AI:

Weather (optional): - Hot / Warm / Cool / Cold / Rain / Snow - Tap Auto to use your location's current weather

Vibe (optional): - Dysphoria Safe: Comfortable, gender-affirming pieces - Confidence Boost: Your best, most empowering items - Dopamine: Fun, colorful, mood-lifting pieces - Neutral: No specific vibe preference

Occasion (optional): - Type in where you're going (e.g., "work", "concert", "coffee date")

Time Available: - Quick: Simple outfits, minimal accessories - Normal: Includes accessories and layering

docs.title: Step 3: Generate

  • Each outfit shows:
  • Item thumbnails

docs.title: Step 4: Panic Pick (Emergency Mode)

docs.title: Bulk Edit Table
docs.text:
What it does: Edit multiple items at once

How to use: 1. Switch to Table View (toggle in top right) 2. Select multiple items using checkboxes 3. Use bulk actions: - Change state (Available → Laundry) - Add tags to multiple items - Delete multiple items - Batch regenerate AI images

ADHD benefit: Reduce repetitive clicks, batch similar tasks

docs.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
docs.text:
Press ? or Shift+/ to see all shortcuts:

  • Navigation:
  • H: Home
  • A: Add Item
  • O: Outfits
  • S: Settings
  • Actions:
  • Esc: Close dialogs, cancel actions
  • Enter: Confirm primary action
  • /: Focus search
  • Bulk Edit:
  • Ctrl/Cmd + A: Select all
  • Delete: Delete selected items

docs.title: Side-by-Side Compare
docs.text: Compare two items before deciding: 1. Select two items in table view 2. Click Compare button 3. View items side-by-side with full details

docs.title: Advanced Search
docs.text: Click More Filters to access: - Search by brand - Filter by multiple tags - Search by color palette - Combine multiple filters

docs.title: Morning Routine: Get Dressed Fast
docs.text:
1. Tap Outfits → Panic Pick
  2. Get one instant outfit suggestion
  3. Wear it and rate it later

docs.title: Weekly Laundry Day
docs.text:
1. Go to Home
  2. Tap category All
  3. Switch to Table View (desktop)
  4. Select all items you just washed
  5. Bulk action: Set State → Available

docs.title: Declutter Session
docs.text:
1. Go to Analytics to see items by category
  2. Identify overcrowded categories
  3. Go to Home → Table View
  4. Select items you haven't worn
  5. Bulk action: Set State → Donate
  6. When ready, take donation items in one trip

docs.title: Plan Outfits for the Week
docs.text:
1. Go to Outfits → Generate
  2. Set Weather for the week
  3. Generate 5-7 outfits
  4. Screenshot or save each
  5. Rate them after wearing

docs.title: Tag Organization
docs.text:
1. Go to Analytics to see your top tags
  2. Notice duplicate tags (e.g., "black" vs "black clothes")
  3. Go to Home → Advanced Search
  4. Search for old tag → Select all
  5. Remove old tag
  6. Add new consistent tag

docs.title: ADHD-Friendly Habits
docs.text:
• Add items immediately: When you buy something new, photograph it right away
  • Use Panic Pick: No shame in letting AI decide
  • Set laundry reminders: Enable in Settings
  • Batch similar tasks: Use bulk edit for repetitive actions
  • Progressive disclosure: Don't fill in every detail—AI can help

docs.title: Photography Tips
docs.text:
• Lay items flat on a neutral surface
  • Use natural light near a window
  • Take photos in batches when energy is high
  • Don't aim for perfection—AI cleans up the image

docs.title: Tagging Strategy
docs.text: Use tags for what matters to you: - Style: goth, punk, emo, soft, edgy - Comfort: comfy, stiff, scratchy, soft - Occasion: work, concert, casual, fancy - Mood: confidence, dysphoria-safe, dopamine - Functional: layering, statement-piece, basics

docs.title: Keyboard Shortcuts (Desktop)
docs.text:
For power users on desktop:

Global: - / - Focus search - g - Open outfit generator - Esc - Close modal/panel

Inventory: - j / k - Next/previous item - Enter - Open selected item - e - Edit selected item - l - Toggle laundry state - d - Mark for donation

Bulk Actions: - Shift + Click - Range select - Cmd/Ctrl + A - Select all - Cmd/Ctrl + Enter - Apply bulk action

Outfits: - o - Open outfit board - p - Panic pick (instant outfit)

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text:
• Can't find an item? Use the search bar (top of home screen)
  • AI not working? Check Analytics → AI Job History for errors
  • Lost data? Import your last backup from Settings
  • Feeling overwhelmed? Use Panic Pick or category tabs to narrow choices

Remember: This app is designed for you. Use it in whatever way reduces friction and makes your life easier. There's no "wrong" way to organize your wardrobe!
